[1/29/16 - LB] Construction on this project stopped several months ago when the developer working on the project ran into financial problems. Building was then put on foreclosure notice by lenders who hold more than $53 million in debt. Building owenrs are now requesting Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection. Turner Construction filed a Chapter 7 bankruptcy liquidation petition for the property on January 4. City of Dallas officials and outside developers have been working to come up with a plan to rescue the redevelopment project. At this time project is unable to move forward but owner hopes the Chapter 11 will at least help lay the ground work to finish the proejct. http://goo.gl/6PBsVL

[8/10/16 - MB] Project is now known as The Drever. The name change comes after this spring`s purchase of the 1.5 million-square-foot vacant tower by California-based Drever Capital Management. Project will combine residential, hotel, spa, retail, office and restaurant. The tower is scheduled to reopen in 2018. Specifics of the project include a 236-room five-star hotel, 348 apartment units, a spa and wellness center plus restaurants, retail and entertainment. BDRC Partner of Dallas is the local partner on the project. This is the largest such redevelopment in Dallas. http://goo.gl/PjOJit Updated project`s name; updated unit count from 335.
[9/19/16 - MB] Drever Capital Management, which bought the former First National Bank Tower earlier this year, wants the Dallas Economic Development Committee to extend its construction time on the building redevelopment until the end of 2018. The city has agreed to contribute $50 million in tax increment financing district funding to remodeling the 52-story high-rise at 1401 Elm St. The original requirement was that the project be completed by the end of 2017. Drever officials say they need the city to extend the completion date to allow it to redesign the makeover and obtain historic tax credits and finalize financing. The downtown tax increment finance district board has recommended giving the developer the extra time. https://goo.gl/GFcba4
[10/3/16 - MB] Dallas-based Lincoln Property Co. has been hired to manage and lease the residential units which will be located on floors 22 through 48 of the building. Slated for completion in spring 2018.
